item.name: OIDC Acquire Token - Step 4 (Hybrid) - Basic Auth

exec: // Store scope, access token and id token to reuse in subsequent calls

item.description:
These 4 requests automate the steps of obtaining an authorisation code by navigating through the mock login and consent screens and obtaining a token using the authorisation code
 Use this approach when testing a client that has been added during the initial setup, as those client are persisted in the mock oidc provider and have been defined as accepting basic client auth.

item.name: OIDC Acquire Token - Step 4.2 (Hybrid) - Private Key JWT

exec: // Store scope, access token and id token to reuse in subsequent calls

item.description:
These 4 requests automate the steps of obtaining an authorisation code by navigating through the mock login and consent screens and obtaining a token using the authorisation code.
 When obtaining the token, it uses private key jwt authentication method. 
 Use this approach when testing a client that has been added using Dynamic Client Registration (Bear in mind that mock-oidc-provider does NOT persist new clients, so after a while they may no longer work)
